content.description: Climb the tower on the right side of Bulldog Balcony.  Incredible climb!
content.location: This is the obvious tower on the right side of Bulldog Balcony.  Scramble up some low angle rock to reach the first bolt.

This climb is located in the narrow corridor between Bulldog Balcony and lower Bulldog Wall.  Approach as for Lower Bulldog and hike around on looker's left and uphill through a steep, loose gully.  There are 3 climbs on this section of Bulldog Balcony; Side Show is the 3rd.

climbs.name: Roberto's (aka Robbie's Road)
climbs.fa: B. Wade, N. Beidleman, B. Ferguson

content.description: Climb strenuously up the large flake and over the steep headwall above to anchors.  Pumpy for the grade!
content.location: This climb is located in the narrow corridor between Bulldog Balcony and lower Bulldog Wall.  Approach as for Lower Bulldog and hike around on looker's left and uphill through a steep, loose gully.  There are 3 climbs on this section of Bulldog Balcony; Roberto's is the first.

content.description:
Climb through a series of overlaps to a chain anchor.  This route has pretty sustained climbing throughout, with a crux that hits you coming around the A-shaped roof and traversing to the huge undercling at the last bolt.

There is a little bit of loose rocks and scary-looking blocks on this route.  It would get much better with traffic.
This is great face climbing on sharp crimps.  The crux comes between the 1st and 2nd bolts.
content.location:
It is 20 feet right of

Call Me Crazy

on the black face.

content.description: Start in the back of the corner under a roof.  Traverse left past two bolts with a bit of demanding climbing up to a good rest.  Move straight up through a small overlap and stem into the corner. The actual crux is clipping the anchors, which requires a few interesting trick moves.  Don't grab the anchor if you want full value.  This route is rather fun because of its overhung nature and gymnastic style even though itÂ’s short.
content.protection: Four bolts to cold shut anchors.
content.location:
As you traverse from right to left at Bulldog Balcony, you will be aiming for a distinct corner/semi cave area on the far left side of the Balcony (See additional description about the approach for the Balcony).  Immediately left of

Call Me Crazy

is Cognac Corner.
